DISTRICTS

BARAMULLA

Baramulla district is one of the 20 districts in the Indian Union Territory of Jammu and Kashmir. Baramulla city is the administrative headquarters of the district. The district is situated at 34.1980° N Longitude and 74.3636° E Latitude, extending over an area of 4190 km², comprises of 524 villages (Census Villages). The town is located on the either banks of river Jehlum, about 55 Kms away from the capital city of Srinagar.

HEAVEN

ON EARTH

Wular Lake is the 2nd largest fresh-water lake of Asia, situated on the foothills of Haramuk Mountain. It is spread in a total area of 200 square km covering almost 24 km in length while its breadth is 10 km.

BEING
BEAUTIFUL
NATURALLY!

Lush green mountains, bathed in the golden glow of the setting sun, rise majestically. Their undulating curves and velvety foliage create a breathtaking landscape.

FAMOUS

WOOVEN AIR

The famous ancient silk route is now dead but it's spirit is carried on by the people of baramulla.

PRESERVING
HISTORY

Science denies magic but what their hands do is nothing short of it. The beautiful big silk carpets are crafted with minute of details.

HAND-MADE
TRADITIONALLY

Red RUBIES
of BARAMULLA

The famous juicy apples of Kashmir which are not only famous in India but have a name for them in the whole vast world are cultivated proudly in BARAMULLA
